Cedric Beust wrote:

> Don't be dogmatic about testing:  test whatever you think can break.  And
> it's okay if it includes private methods.
> 

1. Code can't break if it can't be reached through the public and 
protected interfaces.

2. I've never been able to determine what's too simple to break and what 
merely looks that way. I remain amazed at the number of bugs I've 
uncovered in code that was too simple to break. Even a simple getter 
that merely returns a field value is too simple to break, there's no 
guarantee that it will remain so in the future when some other 
programmer modifies the class's data structures so the getter is no 
longer so simple. Thus I prefer an alternate approach:

Test all code that can be reached. Delete all code that can't be reached.


-- 
Elliotte Rusty Harold  elharo@...
